virtualSegmentConfigNumber.name: virtualSegmentConfigNumber
virtualSegmentConfigNumber.description: The total number of configured virtual segments in the system.

virtualSegmentActiveNumber.name: virtualSegmentActiveNumber
virtualSegmentActiveNumber.description: The total number of active virtual segments in the system.

virtualSegmentTable.name: virtualSegmentTable
virtualSegmentTable.description: The Virtual Segment table. The virtual segment table contains information pertaining the each virtual segment in the system.

virtualSegmentEntry.name: virtualSegmentEntry
virtualSegmentEntry.description: A single entry in the virtual segment table. Virtual segments may be added by specifying a valid status for a non-existant entry in the table. Note that if no other values are specified in the set request, they are defaulted to a value as appropriate to the type of virtual Segment.

virtualSegmentType.name: virtualSegmentType
virtualSegmentType.description: The virtual segment type. When the type is ethernet, a MLT group will be created. When the type is token ring, a token ring vsegment is created.

virtualSegmentId.name: virtualSegmentId
virtualSegmentId.description: The virtual segment identifier. The identifier is interpreted based upon the virtualSegmentType object. For example, the virtualSegmentIdentifier for a token-ring VSegment is the ring number. This identifier must be unique across local VSegments within the specific virtualSegmentType.

virtualSegmentStatus.name: virtualSegmentStatus
virtualSegmentStatus.description: The current status of the virtual Segment entry. VSegments may be added by specifiying a valid status, and removed by specifying an invalid status.

virtualSegmentIfIndex.name: virtualSegmentIfIndex
virtualSegmentIfIndex.description: The value of the instance of the ifIndex object, defined in MIB-II, for the interface corresponding to this VSegment.

virtualSegmentConfiguredPortNumber.name: virtualSegmentConfiguredPortNumber
virtualSegmentConfiguredPortNumber.description: The number of ports configured in this VSegment.

virtualSegmentActivePortNumber.name: virtualSegmentActivePortNumber
virtualSegmentActivePortNumber.description: The number of active ports in this VSegment.

virtualSegmentSpecific.name: virtualSegmentSpecific
virtualSegmentSpecific.description: The object identifier to reference the corresponding instance in a VSegment specific MIB. If this information is not present, its value is set to the OBJECT IDENTIFIER { 0 0 }.

virtualSegmentAdminEncapsulation.name: virtualSegmentAdminEncapsulation
virtualSegmentAdminEncapsulation.description: The encapulation used for generating management frames for multicast, broadcast and unknown destinations. The default values are specific to the virtualSemgentTypeId and are assigned as follows: token-ring: iso88025-tokenRing, ethernet: ethernet-iso88023 Allowable values are also dependant on the virtualSegmentTypeId.

virtualSegmentBridgeGroupIdentifier.name: virtualSegmentBridgeGroupIdentifier
virtualSegmentBridgeGroupIdentifier.description: The spanning tree group identifier corresponding to this virtual segment.

virtualSegmentGroupName.name: virtualSegmentGroupName
virtualSegmentGroupName.description: The MLT group name corresponding to this virtual segment. This value is used for ethernet vsegment type and is ignored for a token ring vsegment type.

virtualSegmentGroupServer.name: virtualSegmentGroupServer
virtualSegmentGroupServer.description: Used to indicate a server is attached to this MLT group. Default condition is false (no server attached to this MLT group).

virtualSegmentPortTable.name: virtualSegmentPortTable
virtualSegmentPortTable.description: The Virtual Segment port configuration table. This table contains information pertaining to the ports belonging to a virtual segment.

virtualSegmentPortEntry.name: virtualSegmentPortEntry
virtualSegmentPortEntry.description: An entry in the virtual Segment port table. Entries are added by specifying the virtualSegmentPortType, virtualSegmentPortIdentifier, virtualSegmentPortCardNumber, and virtualSegmentPortPortNumber. Entries may be deleted simply by invalidating the virtualSegmentPortStatus object.

virtualSegmentPortType.name: virtualSegmentPortType
virtualSegmentPortType.description: The virtual segment type of which this port is a member.

virtualSegmentPortId.name: virtualSegmentPortId
virtualSegmentPortId.description: The virtual segment identifier of which this port is a member.

virtualSegmentPortCardNumber.name: virtualSegmentPortCardNumber
virtualSegmentPortCardNumber.description: The card number for this port in the virtual Segment.

virtualSegmentPortPortNumber.name: virtualSegmentPortPortNumber
virtualSegmentPortPortNumber.description: The port number for this port in the virtual Segment.

virtualSegmentPortStatus.name: virtualSegmentPortStatus
virtualSegmentPortStatus.description: The current status of the entry. Entries may be added by specifying a value of valid, and removed by setting the status to invalid.

virtualSegmentPortIfIndex.name: virtualSegmentPortIfIndex
virtualSegmentPortIfIndex.description: The value for this object identifies the instance of the ifIndex object defined in MIB-II, for the interface corresponding to this port. If no such entry exists, the value 0 may be returned.
